snippet: Prices and sales volume held steady in the second quarter of 2012, because of declining inventory, low interest rates and increased foreign investment.
abstract: Prices and sales volume for Manhattan real estate held steady in the second quarter of 2012, because of declining inventory, low interest rates and increased foreign investment; the median sale price for the second quarter was $840,000, up 2.4 percent from the same period in 2011.
lead_paragraph: Prices and sales volume held steady in the second quarter of 2012, because of declining inventory, low interest rates and increased foreign investment.

headline.seo: Manhattan Real Estate Market Holding Steady in 2012, Report Says
